text: WEAR-TV â€” Our portion of NW Florida & SW Alabama are under Severe T-Storm Watch until 7:00 AM CDT. Storms are moving out of Southern Alabama & SE Mississippi towards our area. Storms will arrive around 3-4 AM and last through 7 AM CDT. UPGRADED FORECAST: All of Northwest Florida is now under an Enhanced Risk (level 3 out of 5) for severe weather. Damaging wind gusts (70-80 mph), large hail & spin-up tornadoes are possible. NW FLORIDA SCHOOL DELAYS FOR FRIDAY MORNING: Escambia County schools are on a 1-hour delay. [Details here.](https://weartv.com/news/local/escambia-county-schools-on-1-hour-delay-friday-due-to-potential-severe-weather#) Santa Rosa County schools are on a 2-hour delay. [Details here.](https://weartv.com/news/local/santa-rosa-county-schools-on-2-hour-delay-friday-due-to-potential-severe-weather#) Okaloosa County schools are on a 3-hour delay. [Details here.](https://weartv.com/news/local/okaloosa-county-schools-on-3-hour-delay-friday-due-to-potential-severe-weather#) LATEST FUTURECAST: The worst of the weather is likely Friday morning before sunrise but some showers and thunderstorms may linger into the midday hours. These mid-late morning thunderstorms carry a low risk for severe weather (level 1 out of 5 risk for severe weather). The rip current risk will remain moderate-high through Friday. Surf and rip current risks decrease through the weekend. The weekend weather will be fantastic with drier air and cooler temps.
